1528337779_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body:
Generating wealth is important. It is how we pulled ourselves up out of the mud as a species. Competition is important it is how we as a society separate the wheat from the chaff. Greed is important, it motivates us to compete and generate wealth which are important for previously mentioned reasons. These are all virtues. However consumption is a vice. Living on debt and beyond our means is a vice. Being greedy to a point that is unbalanced is a vice. 

The life style you describe of living off of 200 dollars per week is nice. Of course it is nice. That is because it is selfish. Selfish things usually feel good. 

It sounds like you overworked yourself, which is also not good, that sounds like a lack of selfishness. Before you were not being selfish enough now you are being too selfish. Life is all about balance. Find balance and find happiness.

No, well then some sort of separation period would be needed in order to figure out whats what since we cant just figure it out by looking at the documentation. You didn't think of that did you.
